notes.text:
This update for dbus-1 fixes the following issue:
	  
Security issue fixed:     
    
- CVE-2019-12749: Fixed an implementation flaw in DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1 which 
  could have allowed local attackers to bypass authentication (bsc#1137832).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: dbus before 1.10.28, 1.12.x before 1.12.16, and 1.13.x before 1.13.12, as used in DBusServer in Canonical Upstart in Ubuntu 14.04 (and in some, less common, uses of dbus-daemon), allows cookie spoofing because of symlink mishandling in the reference implementation of DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1 in the libdbus library. (This only affects the DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1 authentication mechanism.) A malicious client with write access to its own home directory could manipulate a ~/.dbus-keyrings symlink to cause a DBusServer with a different uid to read and write in unintended locations. In the worst case, this could result in the DBusServer reusing a cookie that is known to the malicious client, and treating that cookie as evidence that a subsequent client connection came from an attacker-chosen uid, allowing authentication bypass.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
